html.h1: Welcome to the Splunk Modular Input for Microsoft Message Queuing
html.p: Thank you for downloading the Splunk Modular Input for MSMQ. We hope you will find it useful to you. Please note that this modular input requires specific configuration on your Windows server prior to using this modular input. In addition, the modular input needs to know about the format of the messages that are being received, through the provision of a .NET assembly that formats the messages for output.
You can run the Splunk Modular Input for MSMQ on the following platforms:
Other platforms may work, but they have not been tested.
html.h1: Preparing your server for the Splunk Modular Input for MSMQ
html.p: Prior to installing the Splunk Modular Input for MSMQ, please ensure that the .NET Framework 4.5 and MSMQ Services are installed. These are covered in more detail below.

If you are running Windows Server 2012, then it is likely that the .NET Framework 4.5 is already installed. If you are running Windows Server 2008 R2, you can download the .NET Framework 4.5 from the following location:
Note that the installer will often require that the system be rebooted. If this is a concern, ensure the installation is done during a maintenance window.
Windows Server comes with the MSMQ Server as a Windows Feature. The list of features you need are:
On Windows Server 2008 R2, go into Control Panel and Add/Remove Windows Features. Select the features to install and walk through the resulting wizard to complete the installation.
On Windows Server 2012, open the PowerShell console and type the following:

code.pre: Import-Module ServerManager Add-WindowsFeature MSMQ Add-WindowsFeature MSMQ-Services Add-WindowsFeature MSMQ-Server Add-WindowsFeature MSMQ-Directory

html.p: The addition of the MSMQ server should not require a reboot of the server.
